Description: Upper body fragment of small East Greek black-figured pottery closed vessel; interior reserved; exterior: a lion to left (head preserved); in front of the lion an incised rosette and the remains of a loop; above, narrow lines framing a double dot band. Glaze fired red-brown (2.5 YR 4/6).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 12, no. 34 pl. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.911)
